tn.ref: Shephatiah ... Malkijah
tn.text: The names in this list all refer to men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: will be killed by sword, famine, and plague
tn.text: "will die by sword, famine, and plague" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: He will escape with his own life
tn.text: See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:21:08|21:9]].

tn.ref: This city will be given into the hand of the army of the king of Babylon
tn.text: "I will allow the army of the king of Babylon to conquer Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: he will capture it
tn.text: "his army will capture it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: he is weakening the hands of the fighting men who remain in this city, and the hands of all the people
tn.text: AT: "he is causing the soldiers and all the people in the city to lose courage" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: for this man is not working for safety for this people, but disaster
tn.text: AT: "for Jeremiah is not working to help this people, but he is working to hurt this people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: Look, he is in your hand
tn.text: The word "Look" here adds emphasis to what follows. AT: "See, you have power over him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: threw him into the cistern
tn.text: A "cistern" is a deep hole in the ground used for collecting and storing rain water. AT: "put him into the cistern" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: They lowered Jeremiah down on ropes
tn.text: This tells how they "threw" him into the cistern.

tn.ref: Ebed Melech the Cushite
tn.text: This is the name of a man from Cush. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Now the king
tn.text: Here the word "Now" marks a break in the main storyline where the narrator tells background information about what the king was doing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])

tn.ref: sitting at the Benjamin Gate
tn.text: Zedekiah was probably hearing and judging legal cases. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Benjamin Gate
tn.text: This is an entrance into the city of Jerusalem that people named after Benjamin, Jacob's son.

tn.ref: thirty men
tn.text: AT: "30 men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: let them down by ropes
tn.text: "used ropes to lower them down"

tn.ref: and on top of the ropes
tn.text: "and around the ropes"

tn.ref: they pulled Jeremiah
tn.text: Here the word "they" refers to some of the thirty men who were with Ebed Melech.

tn.ref: If I answer you, will you not certainly kill me?
tn.text: Jeremiah uses this question to express his belief that the king will kill him if he answers truthfully. AT: "If I tell you the truth, you will certainly kill me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: As Yahweh lives, the one who made us
tn.text: The king says this to emphasize that what he is about to say next is true. AT: "Just as it is true that Yahweh, the one who made us, lives, it is true that"

tn.ref: I will not ... give you into the hand of those men
tn.text: Here the word "hand" refers to the men's control or power. AT: "I will not ... allow those men to capture you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: are seeking your life
tn.text: AT: "are trying to kill you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: God of Israel
tn.text: AT: "God of the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: this city will not be burned
tn.text: AT: "the Babylonian army will not burn this city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: this city will be given into the hand of the Chaldeans
tn.text: AT: "I will allow the Chaldeans to conquer this city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: you will not escape from their hand
tn.text: AT: "you will not escape from their power" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: I might be given over into their hand
tn.text: Here "hand" means "control" or "power." AT: "the Chaldeans may give me to the Judeans" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: for them to treat me badly
tn.text: Here the word "them" refers to the Judeans.

tn.ref: They will not give you over to them
tn.text: "The Chaldeans will not give you over to the Judeans." Here "you" refers to Zedekiah. (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: this is what Yahweh has shown me
tn.text: Here the word "this" refers to what Jeremiah will say next.

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Jeremiah continues speaking with King Zedekiah.

tn.ref: All the women who are left ... will be brought out to the officials of the king of Babylon
tn.text: AT: "Soldiers will bring all the women who are left ... out to the officials of the king of Babylon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: You have been deceived by your friends
tn.text: AT: "Your friends have deceived you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Your feet are now sunk into the mud
tn.text: This means that the king is in a difficult or helpless situation. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: For all of your wives and children will be brought out to the Chaldeans
tn.text: AT: "Soldiers will bring your wives and children out to the Chaldeans" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: will not escape from their hand
tn.text: AT: "will not escape from their power" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: You will be captured by the hand of the king of Babylon, and this city will be burned
tn.text: Here "hand" refers to the king's power or his army. AT: "The army of the king of Babylon will capture you and will burn the city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Jonathan
tn.text: See how you translated this name in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:37:14|37:15]].

tn.ref: until the day Jerusalem was captured
tn.text: AT: "until the day that the Babylonian army captured Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
